metadata.title: CVE-2022-48891 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:regulator: da9211: Use irq handler when readyIf the system does not come from reset (like when it is kexec()), theregulator might have an IRQ waiting for us.If we enable the IRQ handler before its structures are ready, we crash.This patch fixes:[    1.141839] Unable to handle kernel read from unreadable memory atvirtual address 0000000000000078[    1.316096] Call trace:[    1.316101]  blocking_notifier_call_chain+0x20/0xa8[    1.322757] cpu cpu0: dummy supplies not allowed for exclusive requests[    1.327823]  regulator_notifier_call_chain+0x1c/0x2c[    1.327825]  da9211_irq_handler+0x68/0xf8[    1.327829]  irq_thread+0x11c/0x234[    1.327833]  kthread+0x13c/0x154

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
